leadAgency: Alabama Department of Economic and Community Affairs (ADECA)
notes: Alabama received $203.4M for FY2026. ADECA developing rules to help healthcare providers and eligible recipients 'apply and compete' for funding under 11 ARHTP initiatives. Entity-level funding expected to be distributed toward end of FY2026 (by Sept 30, 2026). Governor Ivey will issue executive order in early 2026 creating advisory group. Alabama Legislature expected to consider implementation legislation during 2026 session (typically Feb-May). No vendor RFA/RFP posted yet.
programAddress: Alabama Department of Economic and Community Affairs (ADECA), P.O. Box 5690, Montgomery, AL 36103-5690

leadAgency: Alaska Department of Health
notes: Alaska received $272.2M/year for 5 years. Feb 10, 2026 webinar: 'RHTP Funding Application Process' (1-2 PM AKST) - strong signal that portal/LOI launch is imminent. Register: us02web.zoom.us/webinar/register/WN_uo50H7dxQB2SkQjIes4HWw. Jan 14-16 convening already held (recordings on YouTube). Alaska Community Foundation (ACF) is subrecipient administrator; contact rhtp@alaskacf.org. Six initiatives: Healthy Beginnings, Health Care Access, Healthy Communities, Pay for Value, Strengthen Workforce, Spark Technology & Innovation. Broad eligibility: health care providers, THOs, hospitals, clinics, behavioral health, EMS, CBOs, local govts, schools, tech/innovation partners, nonprofits. Public scoring rubric and criteria will be posted. GovDelivery signup: public.govdelivery.com/accounts/AKDHSS/signup/48430. Contact: RHTP@alaska.gov.
programAddress: Alaska Department of Health, 3601 C Street, Suite 902, Anchorage, AK 99503

leadAgency: Arizona Center for Rural Health / AHCCCS / ADHS
notes: Arizona received $167.0M for FY2026. State toolkit page confirms NOFOs/RFPs likely starting March/April 2026, contingent on CMS approving revised budget (submitted Jan 30, 2026; CMS has 30-day review). AHCCCS is designated lead for administering/distributing funds. Four priority areas: Rural Health Education & Training (25%), Behavioral/Maternal/Chronic Disease (15%), Telehealth/Innovation (22%), Medical Equipment & Technology (23%). Lead agencies: Office of Economic Opportunity, AHCCCS, ADHS. Arizona Center for Rural Health offers letters of support via online form. Monitor program toolkit page for NOFO release.
programAddress: Arizona Center for Rural Health, 1295 N. Martin Ave., P.O. Box 245163, Tucson, AZ 85724

leadAgency: Office of Governor Sarah Huckabee Sanders
notes: Arkansas received $208.8M for FY2026. The Governor's office led the application. No downstream RFA, RFP, or subgrant application has been posted yet. The state is in early implementation stages.
programAddress: Office of Governor Sarah Huckabee Sanders, State Capitol, Suite 250, 500 Woodlane Street, Little Rock, AR 72201

leadAgency: California Department of Health Care Access and Information (HCAI)
notes: California received $233.6M for FY2026. HCAI/CalSORH is the lead. Still in planning phase. Stakeholders encouraged to join the Rural Health email listserv for updates on webinars, surveys, and engagement opportunities. Contact: CalSORH@hcai.ca.gov or CalRHT@hcai.ca.gov. RHTP Program Overview, Project Narrative, Budget Narrative, and Project Abstract available on program page.
programAddress: Department of Health Care Access and Information (HCAI), 2020 West El Camino Avenue, Suite 800, Sacramento, CA 95833

leadAgency: Colorado Department of Health Care Policy and Financing (HCPF)
notes: Colorado received $200.1M for FY2026. HCPF is actively developing RFA materials. RHTP Advisory Committee applications open through February 16, 2026. HCPF Hospital Webinar scheduled February 11, 2026 (7:30-10 AM MST) - may provide RFA timeline details. First committee meeting: March 2026. 10 initiatives that providers/nonprofits can submit proposals to fulfill. RFA cannot be finalized until cooperative agreement with CMS is complete. Eligible providers in 52 rural/frontier Colorado counties should monitor for RFA release. Contact: hcpf_RHTP@state.co.us. Newsletter signup via Constant Contact.
programAddress: Department of Health Care Policy and Financing (HCPF), 303 E. 17th Avenue, Suite 1100, Denver, CO 80203

leadAgency: Connecticut Department of Social Services (DSS)
notes: Connecticut received $154.2M for FY2026. State has NOT received CMS authorization to distribute funds - subject to additional negotiation and review. DSS is hiring three positions for RHTP implementation. 31 different initiatives including mobile medical/dental vans and expanded telehealth. Multiple agencies collaborating: DSS, Governor's Office, OPM, DPH, DMHAS, DCF. When vendor applications are released, they will appear on both DSS RHTP page and CT state procurement website. Monitor both regularly.
programAddress: Connecticut Department of Social Services, 55 Farmington Avenue, Hartford, CT 06105

leadAgency: Delaware Division of Public Health
notes: Delaware received $157.4M for FY2026. No dedicated RHTP program page yet (governor.delaware.gov/rural-health-transformation-program returned 404). Governor confirmed 'vast majority of funds' will be awarded through competitive application process, prioritizing vendors demonstrating strongest ability to deliver measurable results. Medical school partnership (Thomas Jefferson University) has specific target: government contract by end of September 2026. For other 14 initiatives (Hope Centers, mobile health, telehealth), no procurement timelines announced. Monitor: MyMarketplace (mymarketplace.delaware.gov) and Bid Solicitation Directory (bids.delaware.gov).
programAddress: Office of Governor Matt Meyer, 150 Martin Luther King Jr Blvd South, Dover, DE 19901

leadAgency: Florida Agency for Health Care Administration (AHCA)
notes: Florida received $209.9M for FY2026. AHCA plans to release an RFA where regional collaboratives (groups of rural and other providers) will submit grant proposals. However, AHCA must first receive legislative appropriation before spending funds - this is a prerequisite blocking RFA release. No RHTP-related solicitations on AHCA procurements page or MyFloridaMarketPlace yet. 15 key initiatives spanning: access to care, behavioral health, telehealth, tele-ICU, workforce development, payment reform, RPM, nutrition/SDOH. Monitor: ahca.myflorida.com/procurements and MyFloridaMarketPlace VIP portal. Contact: RuralHealth@ahca.myflorida.com.
programAddress: Agency for Health Care Administration (AHCA), 2727 Mahan Drive, Tallahassee, FL 32308

leadAgency: Georgia Department of Community Health (DCH)
notes: Georgia received $218.9M for FY2026 under 'GREAT Health' program. Governor's Dec 29, 2025 press release promised 'in the coming weeks, the state will share additional information regarding implementation timelines and next steps.' 29 separate projects across five major categories. Largest bucket ($428M over 5 years) for helping up to 86 eligible hospitals transition to AHEAD Model. No GREAT Health RFPs on DCH Bidding Opportunities page yet. Register for grant announcements with DCH at grants@dch.ga.gov. Contact: GREATHealth@dch.ga.gov.
programAddress: Georgia Department of Community Health, 2 Martin Luther King Jr. Drive SE, East Tower, Atlanta, GA 30334

leadAgency: Executive Office of the State of Hawaii
notes: Hawaii received $188.9M for FY2026 (one of highest per-capita amounts). State has entered formal discussion with CMS regarding implementation and must finalize cooperative agreement before releasing funds. Six coordinated initiatives: Rural Health Information Network (RHIN), Pili Ola Telehealth Network, Rural Infrastructure for Care Access (RICA), and three others. Monitor: HIePRO (hiepro.ehawaii.gov) for procurements once agreement is finalized.
programAddress: Executive Chambers, State Capitol, 415 South Beretania Street, Honolulu, HI 96813

leadAgency: Idaho Department of Health and Welfare (DHW)
notes: Idaho received $186.0M annually for five years (~$930M total). Funding will be subawarded in accordance with Idaho procurement law. Plans include telehealth expansion, workforce recruitment/training, disease prevention, and 3.5% set-aside for tribal health care programs. No RFP or procurement posted on Idaho Division of Purchasing website or DHW program page. Monitor: purchasing.idaho.gov. Contact: IdahoRHTP@dhw.idaho.gov.
programAddress: Idaho Department of Health and Welfare, 450 West State Street, 4th Floor, Boise, ID 83720

leadAgency: Illinois Department of Healthcare and Family Services (HFS)
notes: Illinois received $193.4M for FY2026. HFS applied for $1B total ($200M/year over 5 years). Three initiative categories: Transforming Rural Healthcare, Overcoming Geographic Barriers to Care, Building a Resilient Rural Workforce. No downstream subgrant or vendor opportunities posted yet.
programAddress: Illinois Department of Healthcare and Family Services, 201 South Grand Avenue East, Springfield, IL 62763

leadAgency: Indiana Family and Social Services Administration (FSSA) / Indiana Department of Health
notes: Indiana received $206.9M for FY2026. GROW regional grant application framework published. $600M over 5 years across 8 regional coalitions ($120M annually, $40M-$100M per region). Application materials published by March 1, 2026. TA period: March-July 2026. Applications due July 1, 2026 (no late submissions). Review/scoring: July-September 2026. Grant period begins October 1, 2026. MUST apply as regional coalition - individual applications NOT accepted. Priority: 64 HRSA-designated rural counties + 9 partially-rural counties. Capital costs capped at 20%, EMR at 5%. State-managed application portal available by March 1. Also monitor in.gov/idoa/procurement/current-business-opportunities/ for non-regional procurements. Regional Grants page: in.gov/grow-rural-health/regional-grants/. Contact: GrowRuralHealth@health.in.gov.
programAddress: Indiana Family and Social Services Administration, 402 West Washington Street, Indianapolis, IN 46204

leadAgency: Iowa Department of Health and Human Services
notes: Iowa received $209.0M for FY2026. FIRST STATE IN THE NATION to award RHTP vendor funding. On Jan 30, 2026, Governor Reynolds announced $78.6M+ in competitive RFP awards. Active/awarded RFPs: (1) RFP PHTHORC26009 - Best and Brightest Medical Equipment ($66M, MRI/CT/robotic surgery/linear accelerators), awards finalized; (2) RFP PHTHORC26010 - Best and Brightest Rural Health Workforce ($12.6M, physician/NP/PA recruitment), awards finalized; (3) Health Hub TA Provider and Communities of Care TA Provider contracts awarded Feb 2026. Additional opportunities in pipeline: Cancer Health Hub TA, Cancer Screening, EMS Community Care, Centers of Excellence, Combat Cancer Health Hubs. Health Hub Awardees anticipated to start Oct 1, 2026. Contact: healthyhometowns@hhs.iowa.gov or John McMullen (515) 416-8565.
programAddress: Iowa Department of Health and Human Services, Lucas Building, 321 East 12th Street, Des Moines, IA 50319

leadAgency: Kansas Department of Health and Environment (KDHE)
notes: Kansas received $221.9M for FY2026. KDHE led the application with stakeholder and community engagement. No downstream RFA, RFP, or subgrant application has been posted yet.
programAddress: Kansas Department of Health and Environment, 1000 SW Jackson Street, Suite 540, Topeka, KS 66612

leadAgency: Kentucky Cabinet for Health and Family Services (CHFS) / Dept for Public Health
notes: Kentucky received $212.9M for FY2026 under 'Team Kentucky Rural Health Transformation.' Five interrelated initiatives planned. Regional funds will be awarded via competitive RFA with committee scoring/oversight. Led by RHTP Grant Director within HFS with Executive Oversight and State Steering Committees. Key initiatives include: 24/7 Medical Operations Coordination Center, EMR referral module connecting ~450 rural entities to HIE, 'Rooted in Health' Rural Dental Access Program. Monitor: ruralhealthplan.ky.gov and finance.ky.gov/eProcurement.
programAddress: Cabinet for Health and Family Services, 275 East Main Street, Frankfort, KY 40621

leadAgency: Louisiana Department of Health (LDH)
notes: Louisiana received $208.4M for FY2026 (among highest nationally, top 3 in Southeast). Julie Foster Hagan named Executive Director for RHTP. January 2026 notification target has been missed - no funding opportunity notifications posted as of Feb 2026. Focus areas: chronic/complex conditions, behavioral health, perinatal/postpartum, cancer disparities, workforce, infrastructure (telehealth, EHR). Nearly 1.1M rural residents targeted; 37% on Medicaid. RHTS Webinar presentation (12/4/2025) and community meeting materials available. Contact: RHTP@la.gov.
programName: Rural Health Transformation and Sustainability Program
programAddress: Louisiana Department of Health, 628 N. 4th Street, Baton Rouge, LA 70802

leadAgency: Maine Department of Health and Human Services
notes: Maine received $190.0M for FY2026. No downstream RFA, RFP, or subgrant application has been posted yet.
programAddress: Maine Department of Health and Human Services, 109 Capitol Street, 11 State House Station, Augusta, ME 04333

leadAgency: Maryland Department of Health
notes: Maryland received $168.2M for FY2026. Program page explicitly states upcoming 'opportunities to apply for the RHTP Committee and to submit proposals for competitive subrecipient funding.' Currently in discussion with CMS regarding approved programs and adjusted budget details. Two categories planned: 'immediate impact funds' (shovel-ready activities) and 'transformation funds' (competitive). Sept 2025 RFI received 325+ responses. Monitor program page and state procurement website for announcements. Contact: mdh.transformruralhealth@maryland.gov.
programAddress: Maryland Department of Health, 201 W. Preston Street, Baltimore, MD 21201

leadAgency: Massachusetts Executive Office of Health and Human Services (EOHHS)
notes: Massachusetts received $162.0M for FY2026. Application discusses rural health needs, facility viability, proposed initiatives, metrics/evaluation, sustainability plan. No downstream RFA, RFP, or subgrant application has been posted yet.
programAddress: Executive Office of Health and Human Services, One Ashburton Place, 11th Floor, Boston, MA 02108

leadAgency: Michigan Department of Health and Human Services (MDHHS)
notes: Michigan received $173.1M for FY2026 (CMS approved all activities at reduced scale). MDHHS launched RHTP Listserv for future Grant Funding Opportunity notices - subscribe at MDHHS-RHTP@michigan.gov. Seeking applicants for Rural Health Transformation Advisory Council (announced Jan 13, 2026) - advisory role, not funding. Grants will be available once MDHHS receives final budget approval from CMS. Three priorities: Make Rural America Healthy Again, Sustainable Access, Workforce Development.
programAddress: Michigan Department of Health and Human Services, 333 S. Grand Ave, P.O. Box 30195, Lansing, MI 48909

leadAgency: Minnesota Department of Health
notes: Minnesota received $193.1M for FY2026. Grants page: health.state.mn.us/facilities/ruralhealth/ruraltrans/grants.html. No downstream RFA, RFP, or subgrant application has been posted yet.
programAddress: Minnesota Department of Health, Office of Rural Health and Primary Care, P.O. Box 64975, St. Paul, MN 55164-0975

leadAgency: Mississippi State Department of Health
notes: Mississippi received $205.9M for FY2026. As of Feb 4, 2026, legislators pushing bills to require competitive bidding for vendors/subcontractors under RHTP (statewide health assessments, medical equipment, workforce programs, health IT systems). Bills would require quarterly legislative reporting and prioritize subgrantees in rural areas that haven't received similar appropriations in past 5 years. A House-passed bill would designate a state health information exchange via competitive bidding. Six initiatives: statewide rural health assessment, Coordinated Regional Integrated Systems, Workforce Expansion, Health Technology Advancement, Building Rural Infrastructure.
programAddress: Mississippi Division of Medicaid, 550 High Street, Suite 1000, Jackson, MS 39201

leadAgency: Missouri Department of Social Services
notes: Missouri received $216.3M for FY2026 (9th largest). Detailed procurement roadmap published on dedicated Rural Health page. Upcoming opportunities: Social Care Referral Platform/CIE RFI (Q1 2026), Ambient AI RFI (Q1 2026), Remote Patient Technology feedback (Q2 2026), Social Care Referral Platform/CIE RFP (Q3 2026). Program envisions 7 regional coordinating networks and up to 30 community hubs (2-5 counties each). Plans to hire 100+ people (90 for hubs, 20-25 for regional networks). Largest budget item: 'digital backbone' for data sharing ($364M over 5 years). MHA, Missouri Behavioral Health Council, and Missouri Primary Care Association are tier-one stakeholders. Monitor mydss.mo.gov/mhd/rural-health for new opportunities. ToRCH details: mydss.mo.gov/mhd/ToRCH.
programName: ToRCH Care (Transformation of Rural Community Health Care)
programAddress: Missouri Department of Social Services, MO HealthNet Division, 615 Howerton Court, P.O. Box 6500, Jefferson City, MO 65102-6500

leadAgency: Montana Department of Public Health and Human Services (DPHHS)
notes: Montana received $233.5M for FY2026 (4th highest, up to $1.2B over 5 years). First Stakeholder Advisory Committee meeting held Jan 22, 2026 at MSU with 600+ participants. Revised budget submitted Jan 30; CMS has 30-day review (~March 1). First RFPs expected ~March 2026. Most initiatives via competitive bidding at bids.mt.gov; some via government-to-government contracts or grant applications. Five core initiatives: Workforce, Sustainable Access, Innovative Care, Community Health & Prevention, Technology Innovation. Eligible: tribal nations, government agencies, health care providers, educational institutions, nonprofits. Sign up: ruralhealth.mt.gov. Contact: HHSRuralHealthTransformation@mt.gov.
programAddress: Montana Department of Public Health and Human Services, P.O. Box 4210, Helena, MT 59604-4210

leadAgency: Nebraska Department of Health and Human Services
notes: Nebraska received $218.5M for FY2026. State intends to release multiple RFAs for organizations to apply for funds. However, Nebraska must revise application materials submitted to CMS before work can begin, which is delaying solicitation release. Revised budgets due to CMS by Jan 30, 2026 with 30-day review period - meaning funding may not flow until March 2026 at earliest. Monitor dedicated RHTP page and DHHS Contract Opportunities page. Contact: dhhs.rhtp@nebraska.gov.
programAddress: Nebraska Department of Health and Human Services, 301 Centennial Mall South, Lincoln, NE 68508

leadAgency: Nevada Health Authority
notes: Nevada received $179.9M for FY2026. Program page confirms applications and procurement requirements will be announced 'this spring and summer.' RHTSC Steering Committee application closed Jan 19, 2026. Four funded initiatives with allocations: RHOAP virtual specialty mentorship/RPM/AI (15%, ~$27M/yr), Flex Fund for rural provider infrastructure (20%, ~$36M/yr), Workforce Recruitment and Rural Access (40%, ~$72M/yr), Rural Health Innovation and Technology Grant (15%, ~$27M/yr). Strong preference for awards to rural CAHs, CCBHCs, clinics, FQHCs, school-based health centers. Sign up for NVHA ListServ for announcements. Contact: RHTP@nvha.nv.gov.
programAddress: Nevada Health Authority, 9850 Double R Blvd, Reno, NV 89521

leadAgency: New Hampshire Department of Health and Human Services
notes: New Hampshire received $204.0M for FY2026, the largest award among New England states. Governor Ayotte established GO-NORTH (Governor's Office of New Opportunities & Rural Transformational Health) to oversee implementation. 'Granite Strong. Future Ready.' plan focuses on preventive health, sustainable access, workforce, innovative payment models, technology/digital health. Over 300 stakeholders contributed input. Implementation planning underway with 'initial investments expected to support rural providers beginning in 2026.' Monitor: dhhs.nh.gov RHTP page and Open RFPs page. Contact: RHTF@dhhs.nh.gov.
programAddress: New Hampshire Department of Health and Human Services, 129 Pleasant Street, Concord, NH 03301

leadAgency: New Jersey Department of Health
notes: New Jersey received $147.3M for FY2026 (smallest state award). RFA application window CLOSED (opened Dec 30, 2025, closed Jan 20, 2026). Now in review/award phase. $27.5M distributed via four activity areas: Activity A - Rural Preventive Health ($8M, up to 16 awards of $200K-$800K), Activity B - Telehealth & RPM ($9M, up to 10 awards of $200K-$1M), Activity C - Training & Capacity Building ($500K, up to 3 awards of $50K-$250K), Activity D - Workforce Recruitment/Retention ($10M, single award). Applied via NJ DOH SAGE IntelliGrants portal. RFA document: healthapps.nj.gov/noticeofgrant/documents/DOHP26RHT_rfa.pdf. Project/budget period: Feb 1 - Oct 30, 2026. Eligible: municipal/county governments, educational institutions, hospitals, nonprofits, clinics, CBOs, tribal organizations serving rural NJ. Contact: RHTP.Application@doh.nj.gov.
programName: New Jersey Rural Health Transformation Program
programAddress: New Jersey Department of Health, P.O. Box 360, Trenton, NJ 08625-0360

leadAgency: New Mexico Health Care Authority (HCA)
notes: New Mexico received $211.5M for FY2026. Guidehouse awarded consultant support contract for application preparation. Funding will be distributed through two primary mechanisms: direct subawards and competitive procurements/applications. HCA previously issued RFP 26-630-8000-0007 for consultant support (closed Sept 17, 2025) and RFI for stakeholder input (closed Oct 10, 2025) - both were pre-application, NOT downstream vendor funding. No downstream subgrant or vendor application posted yet. Monitor HCA Open RFPs page (hca.nm.gov/lookingforinformation/open-rfps/).
programName: New Mexico Rural Health Transformation Program
programAddress: New Mexico Health Care Authority, P.O. Box 2348, Santa Fe, NM 87504-2348

leadAgency: New York State Department of Health
notes: New York received $212.1M for FY2026. Four initiatives: Rural Community Health Integration, Technology-Enhanced Primary Care (PCMH with AI), Rural Roots Workforce Development, Technology Innovation/Cybersecurity. January 16, 2026 presentation available on program page. No downstream subgrant or vendor RFA posted yet. Contact: RHTP@health.ny.gov.
programName: Transforming Rural Healthcare in New York
programAddress: New York State Department of Health, Corning Tower, Empire State Plaza, Albany, NY 12237

leadAgency: North Carolina Department of Health and Human Services (NCDHHS)
notes: North Carolina received $213.0M for FY2026. NC ROOTS Hubs are regional, locally governed networks coordinating care across primary care, behavioral health, workforce, value-based payment, digital health. Forthcoming RFA will detail eligibility, governance requirements, and selection criteria for Hub Lead Entities. Jan 16, 2026 town hall held (recording on program page). Jan 30 revised budget due to CMS. Dedicated Rural Health Transformation office to be stood up within NCDHHS by end of March 2026 - RFA unlikely before April. FAQ page available at ncdhhs.gov RHTP site. Contact: monitor ncdhhs.gov RHTP page.
programName: NC ROOTS (Rural Organizations Orchestrating Transformation for Sustainability)
programAddress: NC Department of Health and Human Services, 2001 Mail Service Center, Raleigh, NC 27699-2000

leadAgency: North Dakota Health and Human Services
notes: North Dakota received $198.9M for FY2026 ($500M+ over 5 years). January 2026 subaward target was missed. Grants page live at hhs.nd.gov/rural-health-transformation/grants but shows 'Coming Soon' for all four initiative categories. Awaiting CMS approval of grant application process before live links can be posted. Legislature approved $398M for first two years via special session (bills signed by Governor Armstrong). Budget: $116M access, $33.4M technology, $32.2M workforce, $17.1M healthy lifestyles. Short application turnaround expected once grants open - must commit funds by Oct 2026. Tribal liaison being hired. GovDelivery signup: public.govdelivery.com/accounts/NDDHHS/subscriber/new?topic_id=NDDHHS_189. Contact: rhtp@nd.gov.
programName: North Dakota Rural Health Transformation Program
programAddress: North Dakota Health and Human Services, 600 East Boulevard Ave., Bismarck, ND 58505-0250

leadAgency: Ohio Department of Health
notes: Ohio received $202.0M for FY2026. ACTIVE VENDOR RFP: 'Rural Health Workforce Pipeline; Pathways Upskilling and Retention' (SRC0000036107). Posted Jan 2, 2026, deadline March 10, 2026. Estimated $5M-$15M annually, up to $60M total contract value. Contract period: April 1, 2026 - June 30, 2027 with renewals through June 30, 2031. Scope: statewide workforce pipeline strategy across high schools, career tech, community colleges, universities, and employers in 73 rural counties. Includes apprenticeships, CHW training, recruitment incentives, 6-month housing stipends for 5-year rural service commitments. One award anticipated. Five initiative pillars: Rural Health Innovation Hubs, Emergency Care Transformation, School-Based Health Centers, OH SEE Expansion, Rural Workforce Pipeline. Additional RFPs for other pillars expected. ODH program page blocks automated requests but is accessible in a browser.
programAddress: Ohio Department of Health, 246 N. High Street, Columbus, OH 43215

leadAgency: Oklahoma State Department of Health
notes: Oklahoma received $223.5M for FY2026 (one of highest allocations). State is currently in 30-day CMS review period for budget revisions (award exceeded original $200M projection by $23M). Program page states: 'After approval, funding opportunities will be posted to the RHT Program website as they become available.' Some programs pre-designated to OHCA, which may issue own RFPs independently. Monitor: oklahoma.gov/health/rhtp.html, Oklahoma Central Purchasing, and OHCA Procurement pages. Contact: OklahomaRHTP@health.ok.gov.
programAddress: Oklahoma State Department of Health, 123 Robert S. Kerr Ave., Suite 1702, Oklahoma City, OK 73102-6406

leadAgency: Oregon Health Authority (OHA)
notes: Oregon received $197.3M for FY2026. Three funding distribution mechanisms planned: (1) Catalyst Awards - competitive applications across three initiatives for ready-to-go projects (Healthy Communities & Prevention, Workforce Capacity & Resilience, Technology & Data Modernization); (2) Immediate Impact Awards - direct/non-competitive for state-identified opportunities; (3) Regional Sustainability Awards - subcontractors for rural health network facilitation/TA, Phase 2 competitive. RFGA release Spring 2026, response deadline early summer, awards mid-2026. No limits on entity types. Rural defined as 10+ miles from population center of 40,000+. Contact: RHTP@oha.oregon.gov.
programAddress: Oregon Health Authority, 500 Summer Street NE, E-20, Salem, OR 97301-1097

leadAgency: Pennsylvania Department of Human Services
notes: Pennsylvania received $193.3M for FY2026. $200M/year x 5 years = $1B requested. Funds flowing through eight regional PREP (Partnerships for Regional Economic Performance) organizations, PA AHEC, University of Pittsburgh Medicaid Research Center, and other partners. No specific downstream RFA or vendor application posted yet. Full Rural Health Transformation Plan PDF linked on program page.
programAddress: Pennsylvania Department of Human Services, P.O. Box 2675, Harrisburg, PA 17105-2675

notes: Rhode Island received $156.2M for FY2026. Interest form available to join listserv. EOHHS Rural Health Transformation Grant Initiative page has potential additional updates. Five strategic goals: Making Rural America Healthy Again, Sustainable Access, Workforce Development, Innovative Care, Tech Innovation. Contact: RIDOH.OPCRH@health.ri.gov. Monitor EOHHS page for downstream opportunity announcements.
programName: Rhode Island Rural Health Transformation Program
programAddress: Rhode Island Department of Health, 3 Capitol Hill, Providence, RI 02908

leadAgency: South Carolina Department of Health and Human Services
notes: South Carolina received $200.0M for FY2026. Plan targets rural health disparities through: 'Connections to Care' program, Tech Catalyst Fund for rural health technology startups, mobile health units, workforce development, provider training. No downstream RFA, RFP, or subgrant application has been posted yet.
programName: South Carolina Rural Health Transformation Program

leadAgency: South Dakota Department of Health
notes: South Dakota received $189.5M for FY2026. On Jan 27, 2026, House voted 56-11 to approve HB 1044 granting spending authority for RHTP for first two years. Bill advanced to Senate - legislative spending authority is prerequisite before vendor solicitations can be issued. Plan includes $500M health infrastructure modernization, $125M sustainability grants, $3.5M for CHWs. 10 strategic initiative areas listed on program page. Monitor legislative status of HB 1044 and DOH program page.
programName: South Dakota Rural Health Transformation Project

leadAgency: Tennessee Department of Health
notes: Tennessee received $206.9M for FY2026 ($1B over 5 years). Joint Ways and Means Committee voted unanimously Jan 14, 2026 to accept federal funds. Program page now states: 'Check this Page in the Upcoming Weeks for Information on Competitive Opportunities.' Existing Healthcare Resiliency Program (HRP) at tn.gov/health/hrp.html awards competitive grants for Capital Investments and Practice Transformation - likely model for RHTP distribution. Legislation being introduced in 2026 to eliminate certificate of need and enable full scope of practice (prerequisites tied to RHTP funding). Contact: Rural.Health@tn.gov. Monitor TN DOH rural health page and Central Procurement Office.
programAddress: Tennessee Department of Health, 710 James Robertson Parkway, Nashville, TN 37243

leadAgency: Texas Health and Human Services Commission (HHSC)
notes: Texas received $281.3M for FY2026, the LARGEST state award. 'Rural Texas Strong' six-part strategy. IMPORTANT: HHSC 'is not meeting with potential vendors or applicants to maintain fairness for all parties' - formal quiet period in effect. Six initiatives with specific procurement types: (1) Prevention/wellness - direct awards to rural hospital districts; (2) Patient health portals - RFP; (3) Lone Star Advanced AI and Telehealth - RFP; (4) Healthcare workforce - RFA; (5) Cybersecurity - RFO; (6) Equipment/infrastructure - RFA. Applications expected spring 2026. Subscribe via GovDelivery or monitor Electronic State Business Daily (ESBD). Contact: RuralTexasStrong@hhs.texas.gov.
programName: Rural Texas Strong: Supporting Health and Wellness
programAddress: Texas Health and Human Services Commission, 4601 W. Guadalupe St., Austin, TX 78751

leadAgency: Utah Department of Health and Human Services
notes: Utah received $195.7M for FY2026 ($1B over 5 years). DHHS previously stated plans to issue multiple RFPs 'as early as January 2026' with short submission timelines - this target has slipped. RFIs may also be issued as precursors to formal RFPs. Program page still reads 'actively preparing in anticipation of the Notice of Award' despite award being confirmed Dec 29, 2025. Seven outcome-driven initiatives with itemized budgets in transformation plan. RFPs could appear any week - short turnaround expected when they drop. Contact: ruralhealth@utah.gov.
programAddress: Utah Department of Health and Human Services, 195 North 1950 West, Salt Lake City, UT 84116

leadAgency: Vermont Agency of Human Services
notes: Vermont received $195.1M for FY2026 (among highest per-capita awards). AHS announced it will 'roll out RFPs and procurement options, some as grants and some as contracts.' Plans to post full application and summary on website, set up listserv, and conduct listening webinars for prospective applicants. Nonrural-based providers may apply for projects impacting rural communities. Compressed spending window - agencies must spend by September with reporting 60 days before year-end, creating urgency for rapid procurement. Jan 8, 2026 presentation to House Appropriations available. Monitor AHS website and sign up for forthcoming listserv.
programAddress: Vermont Agency of Human Services, 280 State Drive, Center Building, Waterbury, VT 05671-1080

leadAgency: Virginia Department of Medical Assistance Services (DMAS)
notes: Virginia received $189.5M for FY2026 under 'VA Rural Vitality' initiative. DMAS aims to hire core team staff in early 2026. Implementation support contractors will help launch 'ready-to-launch programs' first. Four initiatives: CareIQ, Homegrown Health Heroes, Connected Care Closer to Home, Live Well Together. Virginia Center for Health Innovation (VCHI) leading independent evaluation. Monitor: DMAS procurement and Virginia Business Opportunities (eVA) portal.
programAddress: Department of Medical Assistance Services, 600 East Broad Street, Suite 1300, Richmond, VA 23219

leadAgency: Washington State Health Care Authority
notes: Washington received $181.3M for FY2026. IMPORTANT: Washington's expected timeline shows CMS approval and funding notification July-September 2026, with first round of funds distributed October 1, 2026 - substantially behind other states. Investment areas: hospital infrastructure, technology, maternal health, new facilities, healthcare workforce housing. Tribal consultation conducted (Dear Tribal Leader Letter Sept 2025). Monitor: HCA program page for announcements.
programAddress: Washington State Health Care Authority, 626 8th Avenue SE, Olympia, WA 98501

leadAgency: Office of Governor Patrick Morrisey
notes: West Virginia received $199.5M for FY2026 (nearly double guaranteed minimum). WV Department of Health launched expansive hiring effort for implementation - positions are 'temporary by design' as a time-limited, performance-driven initiative. House of Delegates passing bills (as recently as Feb 3, 2026) to streamline fund deployment. New DOH program page: health.wv.gov/rural-health-transformation-program. Seven flagship initiatives: Connected Care Grid, Rural Health Link, Mountain State Care Force, Health to Prosperity Pipeline, Personal Health Accelerator, HealthTech Appalachia, value-based payment models. Funds awarded based on need and readiness with emphasis on measurable outcomes. Contact: RHTP@wv.gov.
programName: West Virginia Rural Health Transformation Program
programAddress: Office of the Governor, State Capitol, 1900 Kanawha Blvd. E, Charleston, WV 25305

leadAgency: Wisconsin Department of Health Services (DHS)
notes: Wisconsin received $203.7M for FY2026. RHTP Advisory Council application open through February 27, 2026 (survey.alchemer.com/s3/8621599/DRAFT-RHTP-Advisory-Council-Application) - advisory role, not funding. DHS still recruiting internal management team. 2026 funds distributed in early January, may be spent through Sept 30, 2027. Three initiatives: workforce, technology/innovation, care transformation through partnerships. Plans include competitive grants for innovative workforce projects, closed-loop referral systems, telehealth, multi-sector partnership grants. Subscribe for updates: public.govdelivery.com/accounts/WIDHS/subscriber/new?topic_id=WIDHS_75.
programName: Building a Healthier Future for Rural Wisconsin
programAddress: Wisconsin Department of Health Services, 1 W. Wilson St., Madison, WI 53703

leadAgency: Wyoming Department of Health
notes: Wyoming received $205.0M for FY2026 ($5M more than requested, second-largest per-capita award behind Alaska). Legislature budget session commenced February 9, 2026 - must appropriate funds and establish statutory frameworks before programs can launch. WDH needs to 'issue requests for proposals for various initiatives' - RFPs confirmed coming but cannot be released until legislature acts. Proposed oversight: projects over $500K reviewed by Management Council or legislative body, smaller grants handled by WDH and new advisory committee. Key elements: CAH Basic incentive program, EMS consolidation grants, medical education pipeline with 5-year service commitments.
programAddress: Wyoming Department of Health, 2300 Capitol Ave, Cheyenne, WY 82002
